articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf
articles.title: Defying gravity? What could bring U.S. stocks down to earth
articles.description: The U.S. stock market's relentless drive higher has caused some nail-biting on Wall Street that the rally is about to end. Geopolitical risks – such as the latest escalation of U.S. tensions with Iran - are just one on a list of worries for 2020.
articles.content: NEW YORK (Reuters) - The U.S. stock market’s relentless drive higher has caused some nail-biting on Wall Street that the rally is about to end. Geopolitical risks such as the latest escalation of U.S. tensions with Iran - are just one on a list of worries for… [+5703 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Nigerian police on heightened alert after U.S. killing of Iranian commander
articles.description: Nigerian police have been placed on a heightened state of alert after the U.S. killing of a top Iranian military commander in Iraq sparked fears of public disturbances in the West African country, the police said on Sunday.
articles.content:
ABUJA (Reuters) - Nigerian police have been placed on a heightened state of alert after the U.S. killing of a top Iranian military commander in Iraq sparked fears of public disturbances in the West African country, the police said on Sunday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: MOVES-Credit Suisse hires two Deutsche bankers for China prime brokerage business - Reuters
articles.description: Credit Suisse Group AG said on Monday it had hired two bankers from Deutsche Bank AG for its China prime brokerage business, as part of its expansion plans in the world's second-largest economy.
articles.content:
HONG KONG, Jan 6 (Reuters) - Credit Suisse Group AG said on Monday it had hired two bankers from Deutsche Bank AG for its China prime brokerage business, as part of its expansion plans in the world’s second-largest economy. 
Michelle Lim has been appointed a… [+832 chars]

articles.author: Jonnelle Marte
articles.title: Fed focuses on repo market exit strategy after avoiding year-end crunch
articles.description: Wall Street's worst fears of a year-end funding squeeze never materialized thanks in large part to the quarter-trillion dollars the Federal Reserve stuffed into the market to ensure nothing became gummed up.
articles.content:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Wall Street’s worst fears of a year-end funding squeeze never materialized thanks in large part to the quarter-trillion dollars the Federal Reserve stuffed into the market to ensure nothing became gummed up.

articles.author: Hilary Russ
articles.title: Little Caesars to deliver pizza - finally - with DoorDash service
articles.description: Little Caesars Enterprises Inc will partner with DoorDash Inc to provide pizza delivery services at 3,600 restaurants in the United States and Canada, starting on Monday, DoorDash said.
articles.content:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Little Caesars Enterprises Inc will partner with DoorDash Inc to provide pizza delivery services at 3,600 restaurants in the United States and Canada, starting on Monday, DoorDash said.

articles.title: Weinstein rape trial begins with film producer facing up to life in prison
articles.description: The rape trial of Harvey Weinstein, the former movie mogul who transformed the independent film world with award-winning movies like “Shakespeare in Love” and “The English Patient,” begins this week in Manhattan.
articles.content:
